formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: A LENGTH ERROR occurs with the following message:

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: There are some syntactic elements with handling the way that the ∇ is used, but in addition to this, the input received by AnchorVars isn't right at all. This is because Parse isn't doing its job at all. The issue is that we run the ParseFuncExper before we run the ParseLineVar which turns out to be a mistake. The ParseFuncExpr function doesn't try to consume all of the input, and thus it will take a single variable and parse it as a single function before ever seeing or realizing that we have anything more. In this case, the ParseLinVar will success strictly in cases where the ParseFuncExper will fail, but the ParseFuncExper might succeed where ParseLineVar might also succeed, so we should do the ParseLineVar first instead of last.
